The **drawbridge** is a dungeon feature that occurs in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. The [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle")'s entrance is a drawbridge, and two more are guaranteed on the [Valkyrie quest](/wiki/Valkyrie_quest "Valkyrie quest"). They are widely considered extremely dangerous; however, their threat can easily be managed by a knowledgeable player. Indeed, with a little caution the drawbridge can be a valuable tool.

A closed drawbridge is represented by #, and an open one is represented by ..

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Destruction](#Destruction)
- [2 Castle](#Castle)
  - [2.1 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Valkyrie quest](#Valkyrie_quest)
- [4 Fort Ludios](#Fort_Ludios)
- [5 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
- [6 Reference](#Reference)

## Destruction

If a drawbridge is hit by a force bolt (from the [spell](/wiki/Spell_of_force_bolt "Spell of force bolt") or a [wand of striking](/wiki/Wand_of_striking "Wand of striking")) then it is destroyed. Any non-[phasing](/wiki/Phasing "Phasing") monster in either the "open" square or the "closed" square (the portcullis or the moat) is very likely to die. A player's chance of being killed is not affected by [hit points](/wiki/Hit_points "Hit points") or [armor class](/wiki/Armor_class "Armor class"). However, flying or levitating increases chance of survival.

As of [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0"), iron chains are scattered from the drawbridge's destruction, and they can still hit you outside of those two squares. However, only those squares are considered potentially lethal.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

Once destroyed, a drawbridge can never be recreated. Casting a spell of [wizard lock](/wiki/Spellbook_of_wizard_lock "Spellbook of wizard lock") or zapping a wand of locking at the portcullis square creates an ordinary door.

## Castle

The castle drawbridge can be opened by playing the [passtune](/wiki/Passtune "Passtune") on a [musical instrument](/wiki/Musical_instrument "Musical instrument"). The passtune can be given to you by your god while praying on an [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") or deduced by playing a game of musical mastermind in front of the drawbridge (gears = right note, right position; tumblers = right note, wrong position). Obviously, the [sound](/wiki/Options#sound "Options") option ([acoustics](/wiki/Options#acoustics "Options") in [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0")) must be enabled.

In [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") and variants, manipulating the drawbridge in this way did not advance the turn-counter ([bug C343-318](/wiki/Bugs_in_NetHack_3.4.3#C343-318 "Bugs in NetHack 3.4.3")). This has been fixed in [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0").

The drawbridge can also be opened by a [wand of opening](/wiki/Wand_of_opening "Wand of opening"), [spell of knock](/wiki/Spell_of_knock "Spell of knock"), or the [blessed](/wiki/Blessed "Blessed") [Bell of Opening](/wiki/Bell_of_Opening "Bell of Opening"), and can also be closed by a [wand of locking](/wiki/Wand_of_locking "Wand of locking") or [spell of wizard lock](/wiki/Spellbook_of_wizard_lock "Spellbook of wizard lock").

When a drawbridge closes, monsters (or the player) standing on it or the square it closes onto (the portcullis) will be crushed and killed and their possessions destroyed. Phasing monsters always survive (unless there are phasing monsters on both squares, leaving one with nowhere to go). Flying or levitating victims have a chance of surviving, significantly lessened if on the portcullis[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)—just keep trying. When a drawbridge opens, the same applies to monsters caught under it.

Killing a [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful") monster with a drawbridge has a 50% chance of decrementing your [Luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") because it does not anger the victim first.

Danger (red #) and control zones[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) (green C, pipe) at the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle")

### Strategy

Once you have the passtune, the drawbridge can be opened and closed instantly (and at will) by playing the instrument again. Anything standing on the moat or portcullis squares will be killed, and you will even gain experience for the kill. If a flying monster survives you can just try again, taking zero game time. This is a fairly safe way of clearing out the hordes of monsters in the castle courtyard. Do note however that this will destroy any possessions carried by the monsters you crush. (Also, this advice applies only to vanilla NetHack 3.4.3; the fact that it takes no time is a [bug (C343-318)](/wiki/Bugs_in_NetHack_3.4.3#C343-318 "Bugs in NetHack 3.4.3") that is fixed in most NetHack variants.)

If you stand in a line with the drawbridge and the castle fountain then soldiers inside may try to zap you with wands of striking, destroying the drawbridge. For this reason you should stand a knight's move away from the drawbridge when using it to crush the inhabitants.

Exercise caution when crossing the drawbridge. You never know when a monster with a wand of striking may be lurking. Some players prefer to destroy the bridge when they're done crushing things. Alternatively, [jumping](/wiki/Jumping "Jumping") (other than the [Knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight")'s innate L-jump) can take you through the danger zone in a single move, leaving no time for monsters to destroy the drawbridge under you. Player deaths from the drawbridge are relatively rare, but are particularly feared nonetheless. Likely this is because it is the only non-delayed instadeath for which the immediate cause is outside the player's direct control (a monster zapping a wand of striking), and for which no common resistance provides any protection.

## Valkyrie quest

The drawbridges in the [Valkyrie quest](/wiki/Valkyrie_quest "Valkyrie quest") cannot be opened or closed with a passtune, though they also may be generated raised as of [NetHack 3.6.2](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.2 "NetHack 3.6.2"). The usual methods still work: a wand of locking or wizard lock spell will close them, while a wand of opening, knock spell, or the Bell of Opening will open them. They are subject to being destroyed by force bolts, with the same risk of [instadeath](/wiki/Instadeath "Instadeath") as the Castle drawbridge.

## Fort Ludios

The door beyond the moat of [Fort Ludios](/wiki/Fort_Ludios "Fort Ludios") is not a drawbridge, but an ordinary door with a moat in front of it.

## UnNetHack

[UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") includes drawbridges in additional levels, such as some [Fort Ludios](/wiki/Fort_Ludios "Fort Ludios") variants, [Baalzebub's Lair](/wiki/Baalzebub%27s_Lair "Baalzebub's Lair"), and inside [Moloch's Sanctum](/wiki/Moloch%27s_Sanctum "Moloch's Sanctum"). As with the [valkyrie quest](/wiki/Valkyrie_quest "Valkyrie quest"), the Castle passtune does not work on these drawbridges.

If a huge monster is blocking the drawbridge, it cannot be closed.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5) Additionally, there is a 1/5 chance of the mechanism being "stuck" and not closing per attempt.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6) Both changes are intended to make it harder to use the drawbridge to kill a large number of monsters in quick succession.
